section.title: What is a test Case ?
section.p: TAF TM allows a user to map out their test cases. Please see below for a description of each attribute that may be assigned to a test case.

li.p: Requirement ID(s): The unique ID of one or more user Epics or stories. (e.g. In case of OSS, it is the JIRA ID of the story).
Test Case ID: Unique ID assigned to your test case that should NEVER be changed. Recommendation is to use a reference to parent requirement of feature. E.g TORF-1234_AddNode_Func1
Title: Title of the test case.
Description: A general description of the purpose of the test case.
Pre-Condition: Environmental and state conditions that must be fulfilled before the component or system can be executed with a particular test or test procedure.
Feature: Corresponds to the feature/feature area i.e. PM , FM, CM where test cases were written. A feature is a unit of work that fulfills a requirement.
Components: The component is the underlying module of a feature.

Type: A group of test activities aimed at testing a component or system focused on a specific test objective, i.e. functional test, usability test, regression test etc. A test type may take place on one or more test levels or test phases. (e.g. Functional, Performance, Workflow, etc).
Priority: The level of (business) importance assigned to a test case.
Group: This can be the test phase the test case is applicable for or . E.g. KGB, GAT.
Context: The technology used to interface to the System Under Test.
Execution Type: Manual or Automated Test Case.
Automation Candidate: Select whether this Test Case is a candidate for automation. Options available are 'Yes' and 'No'.
Status: State of the design of the test case specification.
Reviewer: Name of person/group assigned to review this test case.
Intrusive: Intrusive testing: can be considered a type of interrupt testing, which is used to test how well a system reacts to intrusions and interrupts to its normal workflow.
Non-Intrusive testing: that is transparent to the software under test, i.e., does not change its timing or processing characteristics.
Reason: The reason for test case.
Team: The name of the team name who originally wrote the test case.
Suite: The name of the suite to which the test case has been added.
Test Step / Verify Step: Each test case will have one to many test step/verify step pairs.
Files: This is a utility to store files for a test case. The supported file types are "txt", "csv", "py", "sh", "bash", "pyw", "pyo", "pyc", "pyd", "log", "zip", "gzip", "png", "jpg", "gz".

title.b: How to track changes to test cases:

section.p: At the test case level all changes to test cases are tracked via the audit functionality. This means that for every change made to a test case the differences to the previous test case are stored in the TMS database.
